alert.note: Alert for Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 11:38PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marathon County through 1230 AM CDT... At 1137 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dorchester to 8 miles west of Greenwood. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Abbotsford around 1145 PM CDT. Spencer around 1200 AM CDT. Wausau and Rib Mountain around 1210 AM CDT. Weston and Mosinee around 1230 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Edgar, Big Eau Pleine County Park, Moon, Little Chicago, March Rapids, Hamburg, Rib Falls, Fenwood, Camp Phillips Scout Camp and Hogarty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
